text: hi everyone my name is Elina and I work

session so there we talked about what
are the goals that you want to
accomplish for your Java deployment
specifically in the cloud and how grbm
can help you meet them and here is how
so one thing you probably want to
accomplish in the cloud is to start your
applications fast because a it's better
user experience for your users the ones
waiting for your app to become available
but also this means that you can scale
more easily and use fewer resources so
with crl VM and N image specifically you
can make your application start very
fast because you are no longer executing
and compiling your code at run time
instead you're are doing all of this in
build time and then when you actually
start your application it starts very
fast because it's all pre-optimized
pre-compiled ahead of time now startup
time is important but what if you have a
long grunning application so maybe you
care less about startup and you have

where you pay for using CPU for using

so there n image also offers you some
interesting benefits because again we
are no longer compiling code at run time
as a jbm does we do all that at build
time so at run time we don't need to
have all of this code execution
infrastructure anymore you just have
your n executable it runs as a native

for all those code execution
optimization compilation facilities like
when you run on the jvm so it saves you

functional fully static fully self
contained na image application that will
be really small so that your container

like
upx so so far so good we have F startup
we have lower resources usage we have

big performance because specifically for

we would like to have that available for

executes Cod dynamically so it can
optimize on the goal and we know how it
really shines when it comes to Peak

can achieve comparable on par
performance with the jvm and that is if
you are applying an optimization called
profile guide optimizations and it means
that you are collecting profile
information for your application kind of
like jvm does but then you're using this
information you are building your app
ahead of time at the compilation step
and this means that na image kind of
gets an insight into what happens in the

runtime information available to the N
